results.title: The Harvest
results.creator_credit: Fergus McDonell, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A portrayal of the kind of problems a rural clergyman is called upon to solve and how they add meaning to his work. In this film, Rev. Edward Dawson is asked by a farm couple to advise their son George against leaving the land in favor of a factory job in the city. Mr. Dawson finds a parallel between George’s problem and his own, for he too must choose between a city church and his rural calling. He is given cause to re-examine the stewardship with which he is entrusted and in it finds an answer both for himself and for George.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fergus McDonell, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Clash of opinion
results.creator_credit: Margaret Smith, Gregory Clegg and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel Management”.
Discusses the role of personnel management in industrial disputes. A dispute between management and members of a Transport Union is examined. A panel of directors of companies, trade unionists and personnel managers give opinions of how the dispute arose. Stresses the need for good communications between employers and unions and better education on negotiation for shop stewards. A good personnel manager can play an important day to day role in the creation of good relations between workers and management over a long period.

results.title: The Hacktivists [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Ian Walker, Chris Hilton, Laurnet Bocahut, Peter Day, Dominant 7 and Hilton Cordell
results.brief_description: This documentary - an Australian/French co-production - examines Internet based civil action and protests, and the individuals who invent and co-ordinate such exploits. Known as hacktivists, the intention of these protestors is to disrupt business, such as e-commerce and prevent websites from operating effectively. The hacktivists (who range across the globe) are principally concerned with globalisation and capitalism. Their perception is that they are modern dissidents whose activities sit alongside, even boost and support, traditional forms of street protest. In this documentary, several hacktivists are interviewed, discussing their aims, politics and methodology, which may include bombarding companies with emails or performing cyber sit-ins, immobilising a website. These activities are not only effective but also pose a danger to big corporations with net-based trade. There are also interviews with the Canadian police and a cyber expert employed by companies to anticipate and undermine hacktivist activities. One mission of online activism is to explain the philosophy to ordinary people and encourage them to take part. Electro-hippies (as they are known) believe that electronic forms of protest will become even more effective as their methods improve and e-commerce expands. The war looks set to continue.

results.title: The Grievance hearing
results.creator_credit: Art Babbitt, Edward L. Gershman and Academy Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel Management”.
A case study of a grievance, to show how hearings are conducted, what their purposes are and how a willingness to compromise can settle most disputes. In the case shows, a worker out sick for several weeks, has forgotten to notify the company formally of her illness. Under the collective bargaining contract this constitutes an “automatic quit”. Wen the worker returns she finds that her job has been filled. On the basis of her good working record, her three years’ seniority , and the nature of her illness - an operation that prevented her from calling in - the Sop Steward files a grievance. A hearing is held, attended by the Committee Chairman and other members of the Union, the Manager, a Personnel Man, and Mary, the worker. The Company agrees to re-hire Mary, placing her where they can find room; the union agrees that this will not constitute a precedent.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Art Babbitt, Edward L. Gershman and Academy Productions

results.title: Employment interview
results.creator_credit: Art Babbitt, C Moray Foutz and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel Management”.
The importance of the employment interview in getting the right person on the job. A brief review of poor hiring methods is given to illustrate how good workers can be overlooked in favour of less qualified, more aggressive, workers when those who do the hiring are untrained or indifferent. The film then illustrates a good interview, step by step; obtaining information through application forms and friendly discussion, testing, use of rating scale, etc. The function of foreman and supervisors in the interview is discussed, and pre-induction preparation of the applicant hired is shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Art Babbitt, C Moray Foutz and McGraw-Hill Films

results.title: Communications
results.creator_credit: Art Babbitt, C Fouty and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel Management”.
Shows the need for effective communication in industry, not only in sales and production operations, but also in matters concerning the whole plant and its personnel. In the absence of authoritative information, rumours flourish sometimes causing serious tension among personnel, as illustrated in this film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Art Babbitt, C Fouty and McGraw-Hill Films

description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Personnel Management”.
Shows the need for effective communication in industry, not only in sales and production operations, but also in matters concerning the whole plant and its personnel. In the absence of authoritative information, rumours flourish sometimes causing serious tension among personnel, as illustrated in this film.
